# Irvin Stewart

|birth_place  = Fort Worth, Texas
|death_date   =
|death_place  = Washington, D.C.
|party        = Democratic
}}
Irvin Stewart (October 27, 1899 â€“ December 24, 1990) was an American administrator who served as a Commissioner of the Federal Communications Commission from 1934 to 1937 and as the President of West Virginia University from 1946 to 1958.
He died of a stroke on December 24, 1990, in Washington, D.C. at age 91.
See also
*List of presidents of West Virginia University
